commit_message:
Add network-v2 default files + vip data examples

Add a default file for network data and vip data to
use with network-data-v2.

The network data is an empty list, i.e no network
isolation is the default.

The default vip data file keeps one entry for the
ctlplane network, which is the only Virtual IP in
the no network isolation scenarios.

Related-Blueprint: blueprint network-data-v2-ports
Change-Id: Ia50435c0560ed76791d1859612f625a1b776a8b2
(cherry picked from commit be0b91ef564e618ee719d06915cc1dab4624560b)

If this will bring some selinux issues (although I did not hit any such issues during my manual testing. Also our QE did not have any problems with functionality. And the patch is currently backported and used downstream in OSP13), then I will move it to THT. Will add it to THT then.

Create SSL certificates from sslProfiles

Adds function for transforming SSL certificate/key content values
into path values with creating the appropriate files.

Change-Id: Idaee3c5fcc90f8107eac7c2ada94c1e5180abce5

commit_message:
Add support for [oslo_middleware] enable_proxy_headers_parsing

The enable_proxy_haders_parsing parameter was added into Octavia[1] so
that Octavia API can set up the request URL correctly.
This patch adds support for this parameter in octaiva::api module, so
that operators can set it according to their deployment architecture.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/639736/

Change-Id: I985abb8e5dcd6d29e794b200982f8bce99ac316c
(cherry picked from commit ddc7986e1821303b5a444f993888992cf8a7dcd7)
(cherry picked from commit 4b7ee3307c1158ee610f8503206529ce901f9ae5)

commit_message:
Make explicit the network backend used in the CI jobs

All Neutron CI jobs (except for unit, functional and fullstack jobs),
have explicitly defined the network backend used:
- linuxbridge
- ovs
- ovn

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/neutron/+/797051
Change-Id: I1e32e6ffc4a7bca2c185b316e0b4c13820c3946e

commit_message:
Cleanup scheduler

This patch is not changing any functionality, but instead it is
aimed at cleaning up the scheduler code. It also removes the use
of reserved keywords in the scheduler code.

Change-Id: I93cede3371f1ec650adf3b00bf8250457a38f96c

subject: Update to flake8>3.9.0
messages: [{'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-06-28 19:43:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-06-28 20:04:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1131, 'date': '2021-06-28 20:35:08.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nMerging into https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/ovn-octavia-provider/+/779060 as it requires an update'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-28 19:43:59.000000000', 'message': 'Update to flake8>3.9.0

This avoids a failure when you run 'tox -e pep8' locally
as it pulls-in the correct dependencies:

commit_message:
Update to flake8>3.9.0

This avoids a failure when you run 'tox -e pep8' locally
as it pulls-in the correct dependencies:

 flake8.exceptions.PluginRequestedUnknownParameters: "pycodestyle"
 requested unknown parameters causing 'FileProcessor' object has
 no attribute 'indent_size'

Change-Id: I8568b84623adabf99c6ec9b1d63fa50d78002799

[{'created': '2021-06-09 01:20:03.000000000', 'message': 'zuul: Start to migrate nova-live-migration to zuulv3

This initial change introduces a non-voiting
nova-multinode-live-migration check job. This initial job simply runs
the live migration tests against a multinode env.

Future changes will introduce ceph based live migration and evacuation
jobs before removing the original nova-live-migration job.

Change-Id: Ibbb3930a6e629e93a424b3ae048f599f11923be3
(cherry picked from commit 1c733d973015999ee692ed48fb10a282c50fdc49)
'}, {'created': '2021-06-09 21:57:33.000000000', 'message': "zuul: Start to migrate nova-live-migration to zuulv3

This initial change introduces a non-voiting
nova-multinode-live-migration check job. This initial job simply runs
the live migration tests against a multinode env.

Future changes will introduce ceph based live migration and evacuation
jobs before removing the original nova-live-migration job.

NOTE(melwitt): This change squashes the following changes into it to
enable the nova-grenade-multinode and nova-live-migration jobs to pass
at the same time. The nova-grenade-multinode change depends on the
nova-live-migration changes and the nova-live-migration changes depend
on the nova-grenade-multinode change.

zuul: Replace nova-live-migration with zuulv3 jobs

This change removes the original nova-live-migration job and replaces it
directly with the new Focal based zuulv3 native job.

The nova-dsvm-multinode-base base job is no longer used and so also
removed as part of this change.

Note that this new nova-live-migration job does not yet contain any
ceph coverage like the original, this is still pending and will be
completed early in the W cycle.

This change is being merged ahead of this to resolve bug #1901739, a
known QEMU -drive issue caused by the previous jobs use of libvirt 5.4.0
as provided by Ubuntu Bionic. The fix here being the migration to Ubuntu
Focal based jobs and libvirt 6.0.0 that now defaults to using QEMU
-blockdev.

NOTE(lyarwood): This change squashes the following changes into it to
ensure we end up with a passing zuulv3 Focal based job in
stable/victoria. This includes the reintroduction of
nova-dsvm-multinode-base that was incorrectly removed by this change on
master while still being used.

zuul: Introduce nova-evacuate
(cherry picked from commit f357d8040741b0346c3105fb3d3d1b260f5cb13d)

nova-evacuate: Disable libvirtd service and sockets during negative tests
(cherry picked from commit 226250beb6858bb3094c005fbc335a7378531df1)

zuul: Merge nova-evacuate into nova-multinode-live-migration
(cherry picked from commit c0fe95fcc5aec99a83dd57093dc230ef67b36b39)

zuul: Reintroduce nova-dsvm-multinode-base
(cherry picked from commit be752b8175f0cb3444ee47679753be847c8f8fd2)

nova-live-migration: Disable *all* virt services during negative tests
(cherry picked from commit 76360e566bcd0e203f3e9357ca2b0ca3d7baf4b8)

Closes-Bug: #1901739
Change-Id: Ib342e2d3c395830b4667a60de7e492d3b9de2f0a
(cherry picked from commit 4ac4a04d1843b0450e8d6d80189ce3e85253dcd0)
(cherry picked from commit 478be6f4fbbbc7b05becd5dd92a27f0c4e8f8ef8)

zuul: Replace grenade and nova-grenade-multinode with grenade-multinode

If2608406776e0d5a06b726e65b55881e70562d18 dropped the single node
grenade job from the integrated-gate-compute template as it duplicates
the existing grenade-multinode job. However it doesn't remove the
remianing single node grenade job still present in the Nova project.

This change replaces the dsvm based nova-grenade-multinode job with the
zuulv3 native grenade-multinode based job.

Various legacy playbooks and hook scripts are also removed as they are
no longer used. Note that this does result in a loss of coverage for
ceph that should be replaced as soon as a zuulv3 native ceph based
multinode job is available.

Conflicts:
    gate/live_migration/hooks/run_tests.sh

NOTE(melwitt): The conflict is because change
I67255fa1b919a27e92028da95d71ddd4bf53edc1 (lower-constraints: Bump
packaging to 20.4) is not in Ussuri.

Change-Id: I02b2b851a74f24816d2f782a66d94de81ee527b0
(cherry picked from commit 91e53e4c2b90ea57aeac4ec522dd7c8c54961d09)
(cherry picked from commit c45bedd98d50af865d727b7456c974c8e27bff8b)
(cherry picked from commit 2af08fb5ead8ca1fa4d6b8ea00f3c5c3d26e562c)

Change-Id: Ibbb3930a6e629e93a424b3ae048f599f11923be3
(cherry picked from commit 1c733d973015999ee692ed48fb10a282c50fdc49)

commit_message:
[CI] Fix gate by using zuulv3 live migration and grenade jobs

This patch is a combination of several legacy-to-zuulv3 job patches to
unblock the gate: with the latest Ceph release the legacy grenade jobs
started to fail with the following erros (back till ussuri):

'Error EPERM: configuring pool size as 1 is disabled by default.'

The patch contains almost a clean backport of the job configuration.

Conflicts:
    gate/live_migration/hooks/run_tests.sh
    roles/run-evacuate-hook/tasks/main.yaml

NOTE(melwitt): The conflict is because change
I67255fa1b919a27e92028da95d71ddd4bf53edc1 (lower-constraints: Bump
packaging to 20.4) is not in Ussuri.

NOTE(lyarwood): An additional change was required to the
run-evacuate-hook as we are now running against Bionic based hosts.
These hosts only have a single libvirtd service running so stop and
start only this during an evacuation run.

List of included patches:

1. zuul: Start to migrate nova-live-migration to zuulv3

2. zuul: Replace nova-live-migration with zuulv3 jobs

   Closes-Bug: #1901739
   Change-Id: Ib342e2d3c395830b4667a60de7e492d3b9de2f0a
   (cherry picked from commit 4ac4a04d1843b0450e8d6d80189ce3e85253dcd0)
   (cherry picked from commit 478be6f4fbbbc7b05becd5dd92a27f0c4e8f8ef8)

3. zuul: Replace grenade and nova-grenade-multinode with grenade-multinode

   Change-Id: I02b2b851a74f24816d2f782a66d94de81ee527b0
   (cherry picked from commit 91e53e4c2b90ea57aeac4ec522dd7c8c54961d09)
   (cherry picked from commit c45bedd98d50af865d727b7456c974c8e27bff8b)
   (cherry picked from commit 2af08fb5ead8ca1fa4d6b8ea00f3c5c3d26e562c)

Change-Id: Ibbb3930a6e629e93a424b3ae048f599f11923be3
(cherry picked from commit 1c733d973015999ee692ed48fb10a282c50fdc49)

commit_message:
Use OVS backend for testing os-ken library

Only OVS agent uses os-ken library, makes sense that the CI job
testing it uses this backend.

Closes-Bug: #1933626
Change-Id: I8b2eb11dfae5bc67ee9c3629f609e4b461e0ad7c

commit_message:
Add unified quotas infrastructure

This adds some infrastructure to be able to query and honor limits
declared in keystone. It adds a single initial quota value for the
total size of all active images for bootstrapping the tests.

Checking these values is controlled by a new configuration option
that globally enables and disables the checking, defaulting to
False.

Related to blueprint glance-unified-quotas
Change-Id: I8d8f4aaed465486e80be85bc9a5d2c2be7f1ecad

commit_message:
Make explicit the network backend used in the CI jobs

All Neutron CI jobs (except for unit, functional and fullstack jobs),
have explicitly defined the network backend used:
- linuxbridge
- ovs
- ovn

That was discussed and approved during the Neutron CI meetings [1].

[1]https://meetings.opendev.org/meetings/neutron_ci/2021/neutron_ci.2021-06-15-15.00.log.html

Change-Id: I036924f13b77dd5957ad5e60b9f536562deb9f05

messages:
[{'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-03-24 14:49:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-03-24 16:52:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1

we can drop tox env as well as the lower-constraints.xt file too.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-03-24 17:04:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-03-24 17:23:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1

thanks'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-03-25 04:26:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

We have 1 patch for stable/victoria, I guess we need 1 for stable/wallaby as well.'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2021-03-29 12:35:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I don't think we should do this on Master as the job is actually working as intended finally. Dropping these jobs from stable branches I'm all up to."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-04-01 20:29:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> 
> I don't think we should do this on Master as the job is actually working as intended finally. Dropping these jobs from stable branches I'm all up to.

Its up to glance team. It might be working now but it can be broken anytime and if glance team is ok to fix and maintain it on master then fine. In my experience working on last few community-wide goals like upgrading CI CD from Bionic to Focal was 50-60% work was to update the l-c which was not worth as per the need of these l-c by users.

In TC meeting and on ML also we checked and found except Debian(which use these as ref) no body use these lower bounds.

- http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019877.html

many projects including Ironic, Oslo removed/removing these from master branch also."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-04-01 21:00:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> > Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > I don't think we should do this on Master as the job is actually working as intended finally. Dropping these jobs from stable branches I'm all up to.
> 
> Its up to glance team. It might be working now but it can be broken anytime and if glance team is ok to fix and maintain it on master then fine. In my experience working on last few community-wide goals like upgrading CI CD from Bionic to Focal was 50-60% work was to update the l-c which was not worth as per the need of these l-c by users.
> 
> In TC meeting and on ML also we checked and found except Debian(which use these as ref) no body use these lower bounds.
> 
> - http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019877.html
> 
> many projects including Ironic, Oslo removed/removing these from master branch also.

Yeah, nobody is using these as a hard line, and Debian is just advisory. I think it makes no sense to remove them from stable (which we have already done) but keep them on master. The distros pull from stable and those are the more likely to matter in terms of saying "this was the lower bound at the time of the release." Even if Debian uses them as a reference, if we delete them from stable from which they pull, these are of no use to them at that point. Of course, we have to keep testing them there as well to make sure we don't violate the lower constraints with a backport. Further, once current master becomes stable/xena, we'd have to re-delete them from there if they're in master, and keep doing that for each release in the future.

So I think think only two outcomes make sense: (1) delete from master too since these are not used and can't be used from stable anyway or (2) revert the patch that has already removed these from stable and drop the proposed patches to do so on the other branches.

I'm very very much in favor of #1.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-04-01 22:10:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> > Patch Set 2:
> > 
> > > Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> > > 
> > > I don't think we should do this on Master as the job is actually working as intended finally. Dropping these jobs from stable branches I'm all up to.
> > 
> > Its up to glance team. It might be working now but it can be broken anytime and if glance team is ok to fix and maintain it on master then fine. In my experience working on last few community-wide goals like upgrading CI CD from Bionic to Focal was 50-60% work was to update the l-c which was not worth as per the need of these l-c by users.
> > 
> > In TC meeting and on ML also we checked and found except Debian(which use these as ref) no body use these lower bounds.
> > 
> > - http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2021-January/019877.html
> > 
> > many projects including Ironic, Oslo removed/removing these from master branch also.
> 
> Yeah, nobody is using these as a hard line, and Debian is just advisory. I think it makes no sense to remove them from stable (which we have already done) but keep them on master. The distros pull from stable and those are the more likely to matter in terms of saying "this was the lower bound at the time of the release." Even if Debian uses them as a reference, if we delete them from stable from which they pull, these are of no use to them at that point. Of course, we have to keep testing them there as well to make sure we don't violate the lower constraints with a backport. Further, once current master becomes stable/xena, we'd have to re-delete them from there if they're in master, and keep doing that for each release in the future.
> 
> So I think think only two outcomes make sense: (1) delete from master too since these are not used and can't be used from stable anyway or (2) revert the patch that has already removed these from stable and drop the proposed patches to do so on the other branches.
> 
> I'm very very much in favor of #1.

Yes, I agree and this is good point. If any team want to maintain then maintaining in stable as well as master make more sense otherwise just remove it. That is what will match with its usage.

As discussed overall on ML, I too agree on #1.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-04-27 13:15:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Patch Set 2 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-05-07 16:55:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I've based the quotas patches on this patch. More context here:

http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-qa/%23openstack-qa.2021-05-07.log.html#t2021-05-07T16:09:33

But the short story is that adding oslo.limit to our requirements means we have to add it to l-c. There is a dependency between glance->glance_store->keystoneauth->oslo.limit which causes the pip resolver to go into an infinite loop (for me at least) making it not possible to add that dependency without some hacks, re-releasing some oslo libraries to tweak dependencies, etc.

Oslo itself has already dropped l-c testing on master. Problems like this are exactly why I think it makes no sense to continue doing this, and with oslo drifting over time, this is an inevitable future."}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-06-01 14:41:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I am still in favor of removing this from master branch.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-06-02 15:08:00.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Patch Set 3 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-06-02 17:48:20.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5: Patch Set 4 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-06-02 20:43:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

recheck infra issue resolved'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-06-04 14:09:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-06-04 17:08:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7: Patch Set 6 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-06-04 18:34:23.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8: Patch Set 7 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-06-04 20:09:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

recheck infra fail'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-06-14 14:56:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9: Patch Set 8 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-06-21 15:46:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10: Patch Set 9 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-06-24 19:21:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2

I've been thinking about this.  Given that nobody seems to really use the lower-constraints.txt, the utility of having the job is to make sure that the versions of dependencies we're using haven't drifted too far from the minima in requirements.txt (because that's what is in l-c.txt for direct dependencies).  That might still be worth checking occasionally--or you can aggressively update the minima in requirements each cycle to whatever pip freeze gives you at Milestone-3 or so.  I'm inclined to go with the M-3 update strategy on the theory that the minima in requirements.txt are supposed to mean something, and if we have somelib>=1.0 but are running unit, functional, and tempest tests with somelib==3.3, we really have no idea if you can really run our software with somelib==1.0 (even if UTs pass with somelib==1.0).  One downside to aggressive minima updates is that not all platforms may have packages for the exact patch version of some requirement that was updated to the latest version available on pip at M-3.  The other downside is that if any consuming project is maintaining lower-constraints, they'll have to update their l-c to match our minima.

In short, the only reason I can see for keeping l-c is if we want to run a sanity check on what we're claiming are the minimum acceptable versions in requirements.txt--and it's just a sanity check because it only runs UTs.  And if it fails, my inclination would be to update requirements.txt to the version that's currently being used in passing jobs, which would basically put us at the aggressive update strategy, just strung out over a bunch of cycles as stuff breaks, instead of all at once at each M-3.

So I am pro-aggressive-update and anti-lower-constraints job."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-06-24 19:23:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

I didn't approve in case Erno can spot a flaw in my logic."}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2021-06-28 14:20:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

> I didn't approve in case Erno can spot a flaw in my logic.

Note the earlier explanation that I provided about pip going into an infinite loop when adding the oslo.limit dependency. Infra and QA people's suggestion to solve it was "why are you running the l-c tests anyway?"

So if we don't approve this, someone needs to figure out how to reshuffle the reqs so that we can add that limit and not send pip off into a loop.'}, {'account_id': 8122, 'date': '2021-06-28 15:40:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Code-Review+2

Thanks Dan, your latest comment convinced me to +2 this :)'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2021-06-28 16:59:07.000000000', 'content': 'Removed Code-Review-1 by Erno Kuvaja <jokke@usr.fi>
'}, {'account_id': 5202, 'date': '2021-06-28 17:01:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: Workflow+1

Now better understanding the job mechanics as well, lets just stop wasting the infra resources on this. Shame to see we couldn't figure out how to do this with reasonable maintenance and actual meaningful tests."}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2021-06-28 17:02:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Workflow+1'}]

[{'created': '2021-06-19 00:16:24.000000000', 'message': 'Modify default probe timings

This change modifies the keystone probe timings to be less
aggressive. This should prevent the probes from restarting any
keystone-api pods that are under a high volume of traffic as well
as reduce the amount of log spam.

Change-Id: Icce06bf2247591a7b603aa32ded254ce7b6cc67a
'}]
commit_message:
Modify default probe timings

This change modifies the keystone probe timings to be less
aggressive. This should prevent the probes from restarting any
keystone-api pods that are under a high volume of traffic as well
as reduce the amount of log spam.

Change-Id: Icce06bf2247591a7b603aa32ded254ce7b6cc67a

commit_message:
Added cronjob for nova which will be cleaning the databases.

Script has been created with archve_deleted_rows which will run as
cronjob to move the deleted rows from production table to shadow table.

Change-Id: I1cd3e523301b1aaeb3366288d128e23aae5e0780

commit_message:
Use local auth before keystone for s3

This change is to have RGW use local authentication before Keystone
when both are enabled. This can improve performance:

https://cloudblog.switch.ch/2020/02/10/radosgw-keystone-integration-performance-issues-finally-solved/

Given that we do not duplicate local users in keystone with different
passwords this should be a safe change.

Change-Id: I976a47a5d68884ffb54a0ddd8ab802d69cecbf44

subject: Build out runner dir structure
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-25 19:45:59.000000000', 'message': "Build out runner dir structure

Built out an AnsibleRunner directory structure[0] in the config download
directory. Additionally this change fixes the create_config_dir function
to actually create the directory. Previously it didn't actually create
the directory and just removed the existing directory if persist flag is
not set.

[0] https://ansible-runner.readthedocs.io/en/stable/intro.html#runner-artifacts-directory-hierarchy

Change-Id: Ib34b3d3b383336e4d74d1b2f9c3ecebf86af05a5
"}]
commit_message:
Build out runner dir structure

Built out an AnsibleRunner directory structure[0] in the config download
directory. Additionally this change fixes the create_config_dir function
to actually create the directory. Previously it didn't actually create
the directory and just removed the existing directory if persist flag is
not set.

[0] https://ansible-runner.readthedocs.io/en/stable/intro.html#runner-artifacts-directory-hierarchy

Change-Id: Ib34b3d3b383336e4d74d1b2f9c3ecebf86af05a5

commit_message:
chore(openssl): updates cert generation

This patch removes the dependency on cfssl to generate certificates and
removes unused constructs in the script.

Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <t@lam.wtf>

commit_message:

commit_message:
tcib: clean up cinder packages

Prune the list of tcib_packages for cinder services by removing entries
that are already pulled in by other package dependencies.

For the cinder-volume service, the python3-cinderlib package is retained
not because it's required, but because it can be useful in debug
sitations.

Change-Id: Ifa0842a6e19eedd49b6b76ab87801c9694486303

(pmd-auto-lb-load-threshold), variance improvement threshold

commit_message:
pmd auto balance parameters support in ovs

This patch enables the end user to customize PMD load threshold
(pmd-auto-lb-load-threshold), variance improvement threshold
(pmd-auto-lb-improvement-threshold), minimum time between 2 consecutive
PMD auto load balancing iterations(pmd-auto-lb-rebal-interval)
rather than using the default values.

Signed-off-by: yogananth subramanian <ysubrama@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ibb8fce149f2cf9201fc3fd2ff0fb5e1ccd1c0716
(cherry picked from commit 4983761dc4f145a4bfa68ddd0b69177bff7ddb6d)

commit_message:
pmd auto balance parameters support in ovs

This patch enables the end user to customize PMD load threshold
(pmd-auto-lb-load-threshold), variance improvement threshold
(pmd-auto-lb-improvement-threshold), minimum time between 2 consecutive
PMD auto load balancing iterations(pmd-auto-lb-rebal-interval)
rather than using the default values.

Signed-off-by: yogananth subramanian <ysubrama@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ibb8fce149f2cf9201fc3fd2ff0fb5e1ccd1c0716
(cherry picked from commit 4983761dc4f145a4bfa68ddd0b69177bff7ddb6d)

commit_message:
Option to disable Node, Net and VIP provisioning

Add an option '--skip-nodes-and-networks', when this
is set the _provision_networks, _provision_virtual_ips
and _provision_baremetal steps will be skipped.

Change-Id: I2fa073863f2d292575ee1dbdc0da271434f219f6

commit_message:
Allow comments in variable files to be rendered in docs

This change will allow all comments in our variable files to be rendered
normally within our documentation. This will allow folks reading our
documentation to benefit from information we may put in the various
files.

This patch adds ruamel.yaml as new dependency for building documentation
and we won't need to include a README.md file into the documentation
role index anymore.

Co-Authored-By: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I82f68c1d78605e5b48df3d16461e4875d34890d0
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud (Strider) <gchamoul@redhat.com>

added to the Undercloud role. The service is mapped to OS::Heat::None by
default, but when environments/lifecycle/undercloud-upgrade-prepare.yaml

commit_message:
Add OS::TripleO::UndercloudUpgradeEphemeralHeat

A new service, OS::TripleO::Services::UndercloudUpgradeEphemeralHeat is
added to the Undercloud role. The service is mapped to OS::Heat::None by
default, but when environments/lifecycle/undercloud-upgrade-prepare.yaml
is included, the service will be enabled and will migrate any already
deployed stacks in the undercloud's Heat instance to be able to be used
with the ephemeral Heat deployment option from tripleoclient.

Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
Change-Id: If11e2fc07a1ff773f6eaf209d8b48493f0b60e85
(cherry picked from commit b252d45739a9e359a005dfb911dc38d516df4675)

commit_message:
Remove ENABLE_* environment about puglins not installed

Currently we maintain list of installed plugins and not installed
plugins in horizon template but the list has some incorrect/invalid
items. Futhermore kolla sets ENABLE_* to no by default unless
the environments are explicitly set so there is no need to maintain
"uninstalled" items.

This change simplifies the list of plugins to include only installed
and enabled plugins.

Change-Id: I3e7532e0e33326f1e4ff8f59bafe41d8582abd03

messages: [{'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2021-06-23 21:24:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-06-24 19:16:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2021-06-28 13:42:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-23 21:24:10.000000000', 'message': "Add missing ipa images to overcloud-hardened-images-uefi

CI jobs which build images will include a config file then run the
command to build all images. This means that
overcloud-hardened-images-uefi needs to do the same thing as
overcloud-full, and have the image definition for ironic-python-agent
as well as overcloud-hardened-uefi-full.

Without this change the ironic-python-agent image won't be built and
the CI job will fail.

Blueprint: whole-disk-default
Change-Id: I8b5ad48920db4311bf6a63d61fc486446bef8c22
"}]
commit_message:
Add missing ipa images to overcloud-hardened-images-uefi

CI jobs which build images will include a config file then run the
command to build all images. This means that
overcloud-hardened-images-uefi needs to do the same thing as
overcloud-full, and have the image definition for ironic-python-agent
as well as overcloud-hardened-uefi-full.

Without this change the ironic-python-agent image won't be built and
the CI job will fail.

Blueprint: whole-disk-default
Change-Id: I8b5ad48920db4311bf6a63d61fc486446bef8c22

commit_message:
More descriptive task names

As highlighted by marios on [1] and [2] the task names were
not descriptive of what it was being done, as it implied that some kind
of verification was being done.

This patch does not change any functionality, but it changes the names
of the tasks to something more according to what it is being done.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/791450/12/tripleo_ansible/roles/backup_and_restore/tasks/ceph_authentication.yml
[2] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/791450/12/tripleo_ansible/roles/backup_and_restore/tasks/db_backup.yml

Change-Id: I19445ffd1c8d35972fbf8ea3da4a9fbe599f6127
(cherry picked from commit 138f9f6708546cf17f28334be93ee2acc3fbf9a8)

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-28 06:46:08.000000000', 'message': 'Add tripleo_ceph_distribute_keys role

The nodes having an _admin label should be able to interact with
the ceph cluster using the ceph.client.admin keyring. This label
is typically added to the mon/mgr group, but they need the admin
keyring to run any ceph command (via cephadm shell or any other
client tool).
This change just adds a new role to properly distribute the admin
keyring right after the ceph cluster is deployed, and improves the
cephadm.yaml playbook to include this action.

Change-Id: Id17f69c714dec75ec48862f6f0cf900fae5e7c30
(cherry picked from commit 0f40d4b4392fbb8e80dc09b48dd4bfaf4aebf12a)
'}]
commit_message:
Add tripleo_ceph_distribute_keys role

The nodes having an _admin label should be able to interact with
the ceph cluster using the ceph.client.admin keyring. This label
is typically added to the mon/mgr group, but they need the admin
keyring to run any ceph command (via cephadm shell or any other
client tool).
This change just adds a new role to properly distribute the admin
keyring right after the ceph cluster is deployed, and improves the
cephadm.yaml playbook to include this action.

Change-Id: Id17f69c714dec75ec48862f6f0cf900fae5e7c30
(cherry picked from commit 0f40d4b4392fbb8e80dc09b48dd4bfaf4aebf12a)

Set hieradata for the aodh::service_credentials class

This is a prep work to replace the deperecated aodh::auth class by
the new aodh::service_credentials class. The remaining hieradata for
the aodh::auth class will be removed later.

commit_message:
haproxy: Enable httplog for all http endpoints

Currently some http endpoints like glance don't have httplog enabled
thus all access logs in haproxy doesn't include L7 information but only
L4 information.
This change ensures that httplog is enabled for all http endpoints so
that L7 infomation is recorded in haproxy.log.

Closes-Bug: #1930266
Change-Id: Ia98657707adb9c9ec8e0bb7b01931e2bc4997e1d

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-02 15:53:51.000000000', 'message': 'haproxy: Use httpchk instead of tcpchk for heat endpoints

The following change[1] introduced the tcpka option for heat endpoints
but at the same time removed default options including httchk. This
removal switched healthcheck for heat endpoints from httpchk to tcpchk.
Because heat endpoints accepts http requests, httpchk allows more
detailed healthcheck to ensure that heat can handle http requests.
This change restores the httpchk option so that http requests are used
for healthcheck.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/735541

Closes-Bug: #1930600
Change-Id: Ida113dbb250c7a2972a0faf163539e370fa5bda6
'}]
commit_message:
haproxy: Use httpchk instead of tcpchk for heat endpoints

The following change[1] introduced the tcpka option for heat endpoints
but at the same time removed default options including httchk. This
removal switched healthcheck for heat endpoints from httpchk to tcpchk.
Because heat endpoints accepts http requests, httpchk allows more
detailed healthcheck to ensure that heat can handle http requests.
This change restores the httpchk option so that http requests are used
for healthcheck.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/puppet-tripleo/+/735541

Closes-Bug: #1930600
Change-Id: Ida113dbb250c7a2972a0faf163539e370fa5bda6

reopenOnTruncate ensures rsyslog immediately recognizes when a logrotation happens on a file. When not on, rsyslog will wait for a log file to fill to its original capacity before consuming any additional logs.

Setting this here will ensure that every service configured to work with rsyslog will have this parameter. Default to off because this is an experimental feature

(cherry picked from commit 50ed57fd0cb81c90fe218e8bbc3ec8c19485cfe1)
Change-Id: Iba6a0da80cb75a93537a014dba8e77032101e570

commit_message:
Add option for enabling rsyslog reopenOnTruncate

reopenOnTruncate ensures rsyslog immediately recognizes when a logrotation happens on a file. When not on, rsyslog will wait for a log file to fill to its original capacity before consuming any additional logs.

Setting this here will ensure that every service configured to work with rsyslog will have this parameter. Default to off because this is an experimental feature

(cherry picked from commit 50ed57fd0cb81c90fe218e8bbc3ec8c19485cfe1)
Change-Id: Iba6a0da80cb75a93537a014dba8e77032101e570

commit_message:
Add share resource to shared file system

Introduce Shares class with basic methods
including list, create, delete, get and update to
shared file system storage service.

[1] https://tree.taiga.io/project/ashrod98-openstacksdk-manila-support/us/11?kanban-status=2360120

Change-Id: Ia7d7c88eb55307296336e2f04a00e92bdca6f8ae

- Adds labels needed for nginx 0.42.0
- Updates release notes for ingress

commit_message:
kafka broker hosts should be defined with a comma separated list

The broker attribute should use a comma separated list with the port
definition included

Example: kafka1:9092,kafka2:9092,kafka:9092

The kafka client will connect to the first available host this
will provide resiliency if a host is not available

Change-Id: I5f82e96f2aa274379b6d808291d4b5109709bf72

With a jetpack!'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-25 22:30:39.000000000', 'message': 'Fix getting memory size in some lshw output

Due to a regression in lshw introduced by
https://github.com/lyonel/lshw/pull/60, there are some versions in the
wild that do not return sizes for memory banks <32GiB. In those cases,
work around the problem by looking at the top-level size (if available)
to find the total size. Previously we assumed that we only needed the
top-level size when there was no list of memory banks.

The issue is fixed upstream by https://github.com/lyonel/lshw/pull/65,
but the erroneous patch is still present in the lshw-B.02.19.2-5.el8
package in CentOS 8.4 and 8.5.

Note from Backport to Victoria branch:
The stable test data was moved sometime during the Wallaby development
cycle to a separate file, where as in Victoria and earlier, it is based
in the test file itself. The required content was moved into the test
file in line with where it was in the later versions.

Change-Id: I6eb5981d28b9ae368239af0c1d0ec32ff79d95b3
Story: #2008865
Task: 42395
(cherry picked from commit ed791d97786f4ed37bf7b9f18eac8e2af46c3766)
(cherry picked from commit bae3aec172df5b6ca9d609f29ea9feb9f6d11f13)
(cherry picked from commit 97ce08d039099f569c48a2348c784e71e3693829)
(cherry picked from commit 746f65bd8481aac32abb12768590e809697449e4)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix getting memory size in some lshw output

Due to a regression in lshw introduced by
https://github.com/lyonel/lshw/pull/60, there are some versions in the
wild that do not return sizes for memory banks <32GiB. In those cases,
work around the problem by looking at the top-level size (if available)
to find the total size. Previously we assumed that we only needed the
top-level size when there was no list of memory banks.

The issue is fixed upstream by https://github.com/lyonel/lshw/pull/65,
but the erroneous patch is still present in the lshw-B.02.19.2-5.el8
package in CentOS 8.4 and 8.5.

Note from Backport to Victoria branch:
The stable test data was moved sometime during the Wallaby development
cycle to a separate file, where as in Victoria and earlier, it is based
in the test file itself. The required content was moved into the test
file in line with where it was in the later versions.

Change-Id: I6eb5981d28b9ae368239af0c1d0ec32ff79d95b3
Story: #2008865
Task: 42395
(cherry picked from commit ed791d97786f4ed37bf7b9f18eac8e2af46c3766)
(cherry picked from commit bae3aec172df5b6ca9d609f29ea9feb9f6d11f13)
(cherry picked from commit 97ce08d039099f569c48a2348c784e71e3693829)
(cherry picked from commit 746f65bd8481aac32abb12768590e809697449e4)

Fix getting memory size in some lshw output

Due to a regression in lshw introduced by
https://github.com/lyonel/lshw/pull/60, there are some versions in the
wild that do not return sizes for memory banks <32GiB. In those cases,
work around the problem by looking at the top-level size (if available)
to find the total size. Previously we assumed that we only needed the

The issue is fixed upstream by https://github.com/lyonel/lshw/pull/65,

package in CentOS 8.4 and 8.5.

cycle to a separate file, where as in Victoria and earlier, it is based
in the test file itself. The required content was moved into the test

commit_message:
Fix getting memory size in some lshw output

Due to a regression in lshw introduced by
https://github.com/lyonel/lshw/pull/60, there are some versions in the
wild that do not return sizes for memory banks <32GiB. In those cases,
work around the problem by looking at the top-level size (if available)
to find the total size. Previously we assumed that we only needed the
top-level size when there was no list of memory banks.

The issue is fixed upstream by https://github.com/lyonel/lshw/pull/65,
but the erroneous patch is still present in the lshw-B.02.19.2-5.el8
package in CentOS 8.4 and 8.5.

Note from Backport to Victoria branch:
The stable test data was moved sometime during the Wallaby development
cycle to a separate file, where as in Victoria and earlier, it is based
in the test file itself. The required content was moved into the test
file in line with where it was in the later versions.

Change-Id: I6eb5981d28b9ae368239af0c1d0ec32ff79d95b3
Story: #2008865
Task: 42395
(cherry picked from commit ed791d97786f4ed37bf7b9f18eac8e2af46c3766)
(cherry picked from commit bae3aec172df5b6ca9d609f29ea9feb9f6d11f13)

* Hedvig-CI http://os-logserver.hedviginc.com/refs/changes/25/746025/4 : FAILURE'}, {'account_id': 24921, 'date': '2020-08-20 11:15:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

* Hedvig-CI http://os-logserver.hedviginc.com/refs/changes/25/746025/4 : FAILURE'}, {'account_id': 24921, 'date': '2020-08-21 06:46:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

* Hedvig-CI http://os-logserver.hedviginc.com/refs/changes/25/746025/4 : FAILURE'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-08-21 16:16:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-2

Can you say something (maybe on the blueprint) about the use-case for this, because it seems like this feature will cause more problems than it solves.

The only time it is guaranteed not to cause a problem is when the configured backup_swift_container doesn't exist.

Otherwise, if the container already exists, and it was created with a different policy, all PUTs will fail.  So if the operator changes the backup_swift_storage_policy on the cinder side after the container has already been created, backups no longer work.  Or if the operator changes the backup_swift_container to a different container that already exists that has a different storage policy, backups will no longer work.

It seems that the safest thing for an operator to do to take advantage of non-default storage policies in swift would be to coordinate with the swift administrator and ask for a container to be created with the appropriate policy.  The Cinder service is not a "normal" user and has a particular use case for storing volume backups, so I'd imagine that the swift admin might have a definite opinion about what kind of storage policy should be used for the backup container.

But if you really need this configuration option (that's why I'd like to know more about the use case), I think we'll need to implement it so that the backup_swift_storage_policy is only applied to containers on a best-effort basis (i.e., if the container already exists with a different policy, we log a warning and continue).  But as it stands, I'm not convinced this is a good feature.'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-08-21 16:24:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-10-12 13:31:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Please address my question (either here or on the blueprint), or abandon this patch if you no longer think it's a good idea.  If you still want to work on it, you could put it on the agenda for the upcoming PTG:
https://etherpad.opendev.org/p/wallaby-ptg-cinder-planning"}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2020-11-06 09:32:51.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

First off, thanks for notifying me about the duplicate. I think my change is more complete but it faces the same issues as this one.

The problem we have is that we default to a very high IO intensive Swift storage policy that could potentially be pure SSD storage
and when using the per_user option for the Swift driver (the container is created on the customers project dynamically) it's impossible for us to keep track of new containers that needs to be created.

Would it make more sense to add a check that if the container exists and the storage policy is different log a warning and only enforce the container name? Renaming the configuration option to backup_swift_create_storage_policy or similar to only apply on creation.

That would also be compatible with having the storage policy option defaulting to None since there is no behavior change then.

Also, I assume, that when you mean backup is not working is that put_container throws and exception and the backup code path is never continued?"}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2020-12-16 15:38:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> The problem we have is that we default to a very high IO intensive Swift storage policy that could potentially be pure SSD storage
> and when using the per_user option for the Swift driver (the container is created on the customers project dynamically) it's impossible for us to keep track of new containers that needs to be created.

Thanks, that's the context I was missing.  I can see how this is a pain point.

> Would it make more sense to add a check that if the container exists and the storage policy is different log a warning and only enforce the container name? Renaming the configuration option to backup_swift_create_storage_policy or similar to only apply on creation.

That sounds good.  In the help text for the config option, you can mention that it will log a warning if the storage policy can't be enforced and then operators will know to take appropriate action.

> That would also be compatible with having the storage policy option defaulting to None since there is no behavior change then.

Yes, that sounds good.

> Also, I assume, that when you mean backup is not working is that put_container throws and exception and the backup code path is never continued?

Yes, from a quick look at the code, that's what would happen."}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2021-06-28 16:33:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Superseded by https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/cinder/+/761113/'}]

commit_message:
Add backup_swift_storage_policy cfg

Swift has supported different storage policies.
This patch adds backup_swift_storage_policy cfg
in order to support different storage policies.
The storage policy is the same as before if
backup_swift_storage_policy is not set.

Change-Id: I2942202c85931652e613f336f56ec0be0d05b6d6
Implements: blueprint support-different-storage-policy-for-swift

commit_message:
Fix broken test_update_queued_image_with_hidden

This fixes the test to behave the way we expect. It was failing to
do the update because it was using an image the requester did not
own, and asserting the found behavior of 403. However, the intent
here is to allow it to be updated. So, this uses the proper image and
asserts the proper behavior.

Change-Id: I71afe6a877485c8f92e67dcf32bb475c1a1a42a3
Closes-Bug: #1933360

[{'created': '2021-06-11 20:15:42.000000000', 'message': 'WIP: Unskip selinux tests

When we originally merged the selinux tests, we left the two config
options that drive it unset, meaning the test was always skipped. In
its current WIP state, this patch attempts to work out what values
need to be set in the upstream gate.

Change-Id: Icc38f38059803279263f96f24158c62011a4ec68
'}]
commit_message:
WIP: Unskip selinux tests

When we originally merged the selinux tests, we left the two config
options that drive it unset, meaning the test was always skipped. In
its current WIP state, this patch attempts to work out what values
need to be set in the upstream gate.

Change-Id: Icc38f38059803279263f96f24158c62011a4ec68

commit_message:
[WIP] Adding /nodes API

1. GET /<Cluster>/nodegroups/<NodeGroup>/nodes

API to get nodes list based on a given node group

2. GET /<Cluster>/nodes/<ServerID>

API to get a node detailed info based on cluster ID
and server ID.

Task: 39534
Story: 2007590

Change-Id: I9367535ff81a9f657dda62b28d9a7e2d7675b322

commit_message:
Allow user to set sysctl_net_ipv4_tcp_retries2

This patch is adding configuration option to
manipulate with kernel option sysctl_net_ipv4_tcp_retries2.

More informations about kernel option in [1][2]
and RedHat suggestion [3] to set for DBs and HA.

[1]: https://pracucci.com/linux-tcp-rto-min-max-and-tcp-retries2.html
[2]: https://blog.cloudflare.com/when-tcp-sockets-refuse-to-die/
[3]: https://access.redhat.com/solutions/726753

Closes-Bug: #1917068
Change-Id: Ia0decbbfa4e33b1889b635f8bb1c9094567a2ce6
(cherry picked from commit 09d0409ed4a69f514355925754e832e752f817ca)

commit_message:
[Rocky and before] Drop octavia v1 job

Since Octavia EOLed its stable/stein and older branches, there is no
longer octavia v1 job defined. Because the job has been non-voting
let's remove the job to resolve job definition error.

Change-Id: If1b493707bd012d4a779dc6deba1a70ac3293ec6
(cherry picked from commit 863c714bdcb07534ad7cc5991a6d9a1afc655e86)

commit_message:
Use oslo::coordination to manage coordination parameters

This change replaces current implementation to manage coordination
parameters by the base class in puppet-oslo. With this change
the required backend package is installed according to the backend
driver used.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/791628
Change-Id: I210f207d4f05862c98a2ef6d04162880d1cfc4ae

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-16 00:31:04.000000000', 'message': "Remove redundant/legacy is_admin logic

The original model used was to assert is_admin on the object context
which was actually used in only one place in ironic's code. Redudnantly
of course.

This is an excess call of is_admin on all API invocations, and is
simply not necessary as individual calls have API policy checking
and is_admin was only being consulted in the glance service utils...
However, the glance service utils also confirmed it should be able
to access glance if there was an auth_token present on the request
which should also always be the case. This was somewhat identified
as redundant/possible bug during the Wallaby cycle and appears to
be fine to remove

This does *not* remove the deprecated rule. At present, it appears
that rule may not be removed until after Xena.

Change-Id: I5a176f51db93d2a2238496f6955c1c7d9a79c548
"}]
commit_message:
Remove redundant/legacy is_admin logic

The original model used was to assert is_admin on the object context
which was actually used in only one place in ironic's code. Redudnantly
of course.

This is an excess call of is_admin on all API invocations, and is
simply not necessary as individual calls have API policy checking
and is_admin was only being consulted in the glance service utils...
However, the glance service utils also confirmed it should be able
to access glance if there was an auth_token present on the request
which should also always be the case. This was somewhat identified
as redundant/possible bug during the Wallaby cycle and appears to
be fine to remove

This does *not* remove the deprecated rule. At present, it appears
that rule may not be removed until after Xena.

Change-Id: I5a176f51db93d2a2238496f6955c1c7d9a79c548

commit_message:
Continue wallaby development

The master branches of cinder and os-brick are now in xena development,
so while cinderlib is still in wallaby development, we want to use
stable/wallaby cinder and stable/wallaby os-brick for testing cinderlib.
Also use stable/wallaby upper constraints.

Change-Id: I9d76b380d18f5a15fb26496b209b3dd8342e4364

commit_message:
wheel: don't try to release Xenial ARM64

This was missed with Ia44c384072c0482cfd11c642013fd51004f85c8b when we
removed the Xenial ARM64 jobs.

Also cleanup the grafana; additionally remove CentOS 7 ARM64
references which are not present.

commit_message:
[docs] extend bw qos limitations to include pf netdev name

This change updates the limitations section fo the minium
bandwith QoS policy doc to note that when used with sriov interfaces
the parent PF must have a netdev.

Related-Bug: #1915255

commit_message:
[OVN] Add subnet-service-types as supported by OVN mech driver

This API extension is supported by ML2 plugin and is database only
thing. So there is no need to filter it out when OVN backend is used.

Related-Bug: #1933115

openvswitch that might be affecting our jobs.

[{'created': '2021-06-09 18:49:48.000000000', 'message': "[heat] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: Ice2ec661b4b55f55fe536176ed17a44e71bf6c3a
"}]
commit_message:
[heat] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: Ice2ec661b4b55f55fe536176ed17a44e71bf6c3a

revisions:
[{'created': '2020-07-20 14:52:40.000000000', 'message': 'Modify how libvirt related containers use SELinux

1- Add specific mounts in nova_libvirt
They are needed in order to get SELinux support within the container

2- Remove now deprecated docker_enable condition
Since this one isn't needed anymore, just drop it.

3- Drop "z" flag from libvirt related mounts
This avoids relabelling issues from non-privileged containers

4- Set specific labels for the container itself.
See note 2 for more details.

Notes:
1- This will require to patch podman-1.6.4 in order to allow to actually
   use security-opt when --privileged and/or --pid=host are passed[1].

commit_message:
Modify how libvirt related containers use SELinux

1- Add specific mounts in nova_libvirt
They are needed in order to get SELinux support within the container

2- Remove now deprecated docker_enable condition
Since this one isn't needed anymore, just drop it.

3- Drop "z" flag from libvirt related mounts
This avoids relabelling issues from non-privileged containers

4- Set specific labels for the container itself.
See note 2 for more details.

Notes:
1- This will require to patch podman-1.6.4 in order to allow to actually
   use security-opt when --privileged and/or --pid=host are passed[1].

2- The "container_share_t" filetype will be updated in a follow-up to
   the newer version, "container_ro_file_t". This makes backports easier
   to older releases that might not be aware of this new type.
   The follow-up change is purely cosmetic in order to reflect the
   actual behavior of SELinux and has no functional change.

Testing:
The first tests were done using a podman 1.9.3 in order to work around the
mentionned issues.

Newer tests were done using podman 1.6.4 scratch-builds in order to ensure
the reported issues were fixed.

[1] https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1846364

commit_message:
Retry "lvs" call on segfault for _get_thin_pool_free_space

This is a follow-up to I6824ba4f.

LVM commands segfault occasionally, exiting with code 139.
Change I6824ba4f introduced a workaround to retry the command
when code 139 is returned, which generally works.  This expands
that retry to the case where thin pool space is queried, which
currently results in the LVM driver reporting no free space to
the scheduler.

Further work is needed to expand this to other LVM calls, but
this patch is narrow in scope to target a particular gate
failure.

Related-Bug: #1901783
Partial-Bug: #1932188
Closes-Bug: #1932287
Change-Id: I0a2420f3e4a411f5fa52ebe2d22859b138ef387f
(cherry picked from commit 410306efb82760191e76b4d40817f38842d87eb0)

commit_message:
Remove experimental from s3 options

Remove the experimental status from the S3 options. Update the
README documentation to provide information on configuring the
appropriate backend to use for NFS or S3 storage.

This change is mainly copied from the corresponding change to
trilio-wlm ( I7836754529a8b5d067a86077e1e004fa2f53ec6e ). Bug
1933809 *1 is tracking the consolidation of duplicate code.

*1 https://bugs.launchpad.net/charm-trilio-data-mover/+bug/1933809

Change-Id: I868240fee4f5e767c9dac2d41ddc128bc307e4ae

Set fixture paths for unit tests

This change defines manifest_dir and module_path expicitly in unit
tests so that modules installed under fixtures directory is properly
loaded.

commit_message:
Add support for MultiStrOpt

This replaces the provider implementation of heat_config type so that
MultiStrOpt, which is used by several options like
 - oslo_messaging_notifications/driver
 - oslo_policy/policy_dirs
is handled correctly.

Change-Id: Ifb3a302e1e15b496761112936c847217ec2116cc

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-25 10:51:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix "Remove chrony in a container" patch with test

Unfortunately, the original patch didn't work [1].  Then a fix was
applied also without a test [2].  Unfortunately, this wasn't correct
either.

This patch simplifies the function, which makes it a little easier to
reason about.  Also a test is added to stop regressions in the future.

[1] Ie3c9c5899c1d46edd21c32868938d3290db321e7
[2] Ifef76eacd8bd837d2181ec75e406aa35f88b8b5b
Closes-Bug: #1929054

Change-Id: I93f53274bc8c7e62ebb8cb7bf81ff816f4bfd98b
(cherry picked from commit 626a5ce3ca868286d7341fd7e53e9e161f969ecc)
'}, {'created': '2021-05-25 12:43:47.000000000', 'message': "filter_missing_packages expects a list, not string

filter_missing_packages expects a list and not a single package name as
a string. Pass the chrony package as a single item list to avoid it
checking installation candiates for 'c', 'h', 'r', 'o', 'n' and 'y'

This patch simplifies the function, which makes it a little easier to
reason about.  Also a test is added to stop regressions in the future.

[1] Ie3c9c5899c1d46edd21c32868938d3290db321e7
[2] Ifef76eacd8bd837d2181ec75e406aa35f88b8b5b
Closes-Bug: #1929054

Change-Id: I93f53274bc8c7e62ebb8cb7bf81ff816f4bfd98b
"}]
commit_message:
filter_missing_packages expects a list, not string

filter_missing_packages expects a list and not a single package name as
a string. Pass the chrony package as a single item list to avoid it
checking installation candiates for 'c', 'h', 'r', 'o', 'n' and 'y'

This patch simplifies the function, which makes it a little easier to
reason about.  Also a test is added to stop regressions in the future.

[1] Ie3c9c5899c1d46edd21c32868938d3290db321e7
[2] Ifef76eacd8bd837d2181ec75e406aa35f88b8b5b
Closes-Bug: #1929054

Change-Id: I93f53274bc8c7e62ebb8cb7bf81ff816f4bfd98b

commit_message:
vpp: Allow setting the host parameter

This change allows users to set the host parmeter for ml2+vpp plugin.
The parameter was hard-coded by $::hostname but it would result in
incosnsistency with the hostname set by neutron::host .

Change-Id: I25bef469a1caeede529054579d014788b84de9e4

commit_message:
use callback payloads for SECURITY_GROUP

This patch switches over to callback payloads for SECURITY_GROUP
events. To do so a few shims are put into place the handle both
payload and kwarg style callbacks; these shims will be removed once
all events use payloads. In addition a few UT updates are included to
get the tests working properly with payloads.

Change-Id: I6161a8b387812808c4d679f882a3193c93235647

Is it really necessary to enable volume as default for multinode?'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2021-03-29 20:36:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

What benefit does this provide for multinode?'}, {'account_id': 30449, 'date': '2021-03-30 01:51:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

> Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> 
> What benefit does this provide for multinode?

I just saw mariadb README about:
The StatefulSets all leverage PVCs to provide stateful storage to
``/var/lib/mysql``.
and
StatefulSet is stateful. If you mount a hostpath, you will have one less copy of a hostpath, because the local disk on which the hostpath was mounted when the hostpath was started will not be able to mount the same copy on any other node. If you use PVC, you can now make sure that when a copy is hung, it will start a new one on another node, and still mount the PVC.'}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2021-03-30 15:12:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: -Code-Review

> Patch Set 2:
> 
> > Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1
> > 
> > What benefit does this provide for multinode?
> 
> I just saw mariadb README about:
> The StatefulSets all leverage PVCs to provide stateful storage to
> ``/var/lib/mysql``.
> and
> StatefulSet is stateful. If you mount a hostpath, you will have one less copy of a hostpath, because the local disk on which the hostpath was mounted when the hostpath was started will not be able to mount the same copy on any other node. If you use PVC, you can now make sure that when a copy is hung, it will start a new one on another node, and still mount the PVC.

MariaDB enable volume by default

The StatefulSets all leverage PVCs to provide stateful storage.

Change-Id: I718a8170109028b2a5aa78d9c35839eaeb8982c7

subject: retire puppet-panko
messages:
[{'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-06-16 15:05:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-06-16 15:23:36.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Without these changes our machinery will fail to detect the deliverable type and so we will fall into the same trap that with train:

```
deliverables/train/puppet-panko.yaml: validate_release_type: openstack-infra/project-config/zuul.d/projects.yaml no release job specified for openstack/puppet-panko, one of ['publish-to-pypi'] needs to be included in ['puppet-openstack-check-jobs', 'puppet-openstack-module-unit-jobs', 'puppet-openstack-integration-jobs-scenario001', 'puppet-openstack-beaker-jobs', 'release-notes-jobs-python3'] or no release will be published
```

This due to our validation that determine the type of the deliverable by parsing the repo's content on the master branch, however, when a repo is retired the master branch is almost empty so we fail to retrive the type.

https://opendev.org/openstack/releases/src/branch/master/openstack_releases/puppetutils.py#L19-L26

This flag will allow us to ignore that.

I proposed to append more check to determine the deliverable type [1], however we don't think that's the right approach.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/releases/+/796683"}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-06-16 15:42:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Do we need the same for Q and R ?
These two branches are still in EM phase and are not yet EOLed. I guess we need this for these two branches otherwise we experience the same issue when creating -eol tags.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-06-17 11:29:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> Patch Set 1:
> 
> Do we need the same for Q and R ?
> These two branches are still in EM phase and are not yet EOLed. I guess we need this for these two branches otherwise we experience the same issue when creating -eol tags.

Ah yes exact, good catch'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-06-17 11:32:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2021-06-18 14:45:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9414, 'date': '2021-06-22 08:42:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2021-06-24 08:57:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2

This has zhongshengping's +1 so I think we could merge it."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2021-06-24 14:19:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-06-28 10:51:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
Safely delete node from ring

Provide the delete-node-from-ring action to safely remove a known node
from the corosync ring.

Update the less safe update-ring action to avoid LP Bug #1933223 and
provide warnings in actions.yaml on its use.

Change-Id: I56cf2360ac41b12fc0a508881897ba63a5e89dbd
Closes-Bug: #1933223

messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-05-11 23:23:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-05-12 01:59:35.000000000', 'content': 'Topic lint removed'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-05-12 01:59:38.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to listopts'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-05-12 01:59:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-05-17 15:52:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2021-06-28 09:02:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-05-11 23:23:18.000000000', 'message': 'Cors: Accept array for ListOpts

The following four parameters of cors middleware are ListOpt, thus
accepting array for these options allows users to define parameters
in a similar format.

 - allowed_origin
 - expose_headers
 - allow_methods
 - allow_headers

Change-Id: I4478d209c23e7468e6f36fe417acc01d7b986938
'}]
commit_message:
Cors: Accept array for ListOpts

The following four parameters of cors middleware are ListOpt, thus
accepting array for these options allows users to define parameters
in a similar format.

 - allowed_origin
 - expose_headers
 - allow_methods
 - allow_headers

Change-Id: I4478d209c23e7468e6f36fe417acc01d7b986938

commit_message:
Only mount the ESP if not yet mounted

Check if the ESP is already mounted before attempting to mount it
for the bootloader installation.

Change-Id: Ifd738b2c5663f1a211d7e13b5ba386be631d8db1
(cherry picked from commit 27568204aeb7f063bf236ad7f2f8043db627baa9)

messages:
[{'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-06-09 19:27:33.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2021-06-09 22:03:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

FYI, tricircle project is retired and no active team exist for these deliverables.'}, {'account_id': 17685, 'date': '2021-06-17 15:25:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

Thanks for the information Ghanshyam! In that case we can proceed with this one.'}, {'account_id': 28522, 'date': '2021-06-28 10:47:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-09 19:27:33.000000000', 'message': "[tricircle] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: I4383393afd59e98f9de04aa6171aea9f262e82cd
"}]
commit_message:
[tricircle] Transition Ocata to End of Life

This transition the Ocata branch to End of Life. The last patch of the
branch will be tagged with ocata-eol tag. The ocata branch cannot be
used anymore and will be deleted if this patch merges.

This is needed as stable/ocata is not actively maintained in the recent
period and thus gate is broken due to job failures. By removing these
branches, infra resources will be freed up, too.

Please try to identify any zuul job, that is defined outside of the
repositories in this patch (for example in openstack-zuul-jobs, etc.)
and won't be used anymore if stable/ocata is deleted, and propose a job
removal patch for them.

Please +1 if the team is ready for us to proceed with this transition,
or -1 if there are still some activity on the branch and the team wants
to continue to maintain it.

Change-Id: I4383393afd59e98f9de04aa6171aea9f262e82cd

commit_message:
Fix using host_routes in VIP subnet with amphorav2

Ensure that amphorae_network_config parameter is not modified in
AmphoraPostVIPPlug. Modifying it would break amphorav2 persistence by
introducing non-serializable elements in the subnet dict

Story: 2008955
Task: 42580

Change-Id: I8f0d3ba1d083c7e37e7e26617826400a538a0890

[{'created': '2021-06-25 16:37:05.000000000', 'message': 'Coalesce heartbeats

The IPA sends heartbeats to the conductor periodically and when
requested, e.g. at the end of asynchronous commands. In order
to avoid to send such notifications in too quick succession,
e.g. when two asynchronous commands finish at the same time or
when the periodic heartbeat was just sent right before a command
ended, this patch proposes to coalesce heartbeats which are
close together timewise and send only one for all of them
in a time interval of 5 seconds.

Co-Authored-By: Arne Wiebalck <arne.wiebalck@cern.ch>

Story: #2008983
Task: 42633

Change-Id: Idfbce44065e1e5a8b730b94741b2604c51f0ab14
(cherry picked from commit b605943796c24a174f0709b84170e0c6de7f4238)
'}]
commit_message:
Coalesce heartbeats

The IPA sends heartbeats to the conductor periodically and when
requested, e.g. at the end of asynchronous commands. In order
to avoid to send such notifications in too quick succession,
e.g. when two asynchronous commands finish at the same time or
when the periodic heartbeat was just sent right before a command
ended, this patch proposes to coalesce heartbeats which are
close together timewise and send only one for all of them
in a time interval of 5 seconds.

Co-Authored-By: Arne Wiebalck <arne.wiebalck@cern.ch>

Story: #2008983
Task: 42633

Change-Id: Idfbce44065e1e5a8b730b94741b2604c51f0ab14
(cherry picked from commit b605943796c24a174f0709b84170e0c6de7f4238)

commit_message:
Remove logger for nose.plugin.manager

Horizon has switched test runnner from nose to default Django test
runner a while ago[1], and doesn't require logger for nose module
since then.

[1] 1f80d94459856a8c477310cc0fe4b0e165d8c0c1

Change-Id: Id8e4f4f9320e236e16b6e32f9b6a459f3fd10ece

subject: Module: tripleo_unprovision_network and cli playbook
messages: [{'account_id': 29775, 'date': '2021-06-28 10:56:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29775, 'date': '2021-06-28 10:59:13.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nduplicate id created of https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/tripleo-ansible/+/773021'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-28 10:56:25.000000000', 'message': 'Module: tripleo_unprovision_network and cli playbook

Add the ansible module `tripleo_unprovision_network`. Currently, We
don't have an automated way to clear the resources which we create
using "openstack network provision" command /
`tripleo_composable_network` module.  This module will be used to
delete the composable networks.

We expect user to pass the required network-data.yaml when
to the unprovision command which we added in patch[1].

This module only delete subnet/networks that are defined in net-data
passed via network-data.yaml. This module will only delete a subnet
if there are no ports from corresponding subnets, A network will only
be deleted if there are no subnets in that network (This is to
safeguard us from scenarios where same networks are used with
different subnets for the separate overcloud stacks).

Also, Adds CLI playbook cli-overcloud-network-unprovision.yaml
Playbook loads configuration data file, iterates over each composable
network definition and calls the tripleo_unprovision_network to delete
the network.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/773034
Change-Id: Ibef1d21c4d1f911e9c8ccc27253439c336c2420c

Change-Id: I629089ed09a0fc5b0ff320e518cbf551c02e1e88
'}]
commit_message:
Module: tripleo_unprovision_network and cli playbook

Add the ansible module `tripleo_unprovision_network`. Currently, We
don't have an automated way to clear the resources which we create
using "openstack network provision" command /
`tripleo_composable_network` module.  This module will be used to
delete the composable networks.

We expect user to pass the required network-data.yaml when
to the unprovision command which we added in patch[1].

This module only delete subnet/networks that are defined in net-data
passed via network-data.yaml. This module will only delete a subnet
if there are no ports from corresponding subnets, A network will only
be deleted if there are no subnets in that network (This is to
safeguard us from scenarios where same networks are used with
different subnets for the separate overcloud stacks).

Also, Adds CLI playbook cli-overcloud-network-unprovision.yaml
Playbook loads configuration data file, iterates over each composable
network definition and calls the tripleo_unprovision_network to delete
the network.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/python-tripleoclient/+/773034
Change-Id: Ibef1d21c4d1f911e9c8ccc27253439c336c2420c

Change-Id: I629089ed09a0fc5b0ff320e518cbf551c02e1e88

doc/source/contributing.rst to CONTRIBUTING.rst file.

It also removes the installation.rst because we have the same content in

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-06-08 05:08:52.000000000', 'message': 'Add support for independent heat-dashboard configurations

Currently horizon supports per-dashboard configurations in
/etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings.d. Each dashboard plugin
provides a specific file to define its parameters, and any parameters
used in dashboard plugins have been removed from the base
local_settings(.py) in horizon repo.

To follow how each plugin is supposed to have its configurations
managed, this change introduces an independent file for heat-dashboard.
Support for the other dashboards like manila-ui, octavia-ui, and etc
will be added later.

Conflicts:
	manifests/init.pp
	manifests/params.pp
	spec/classes/horizon_init_spec.rb
	templates/local_settings.py.erb

Backport note:
To minimize effect of this backport, the following change was made.
- The enable_user_pass parameter is not deprecated by this patch.

- Users can set the enable_user_pass parameter to undef to remove
  OPENSTACK_HEAT_STACK from local_settings.

- heatclient logging setting is left in local_settings, because
  consistent configuration is added.

Change-Id: I5999c2eaf8d7788d3c0d76e69a56a0b10058dfe9
(cherry picked from commit 382877dd4c8ee321eff1846c7c7afe4104dbd58f)

commit_message:
Add support for independent heat-dashboard configurations

Currently horizon supports per-dashboard configurations in
/etc/openstack-dashboard/local_settings.d. Each dashboard plugin
provides a specific file to define its parameters, and any parameters
used in dashboard plugins have been removed from the base
local_settings(.py) in horizon repo.

To follow how each plugin is supposed to have its configurations
managed, this change introduces an independent file for heat-dashboard.
Support for the other dashboards like manila-ui, octavia-ui, and etc
will be added later.

Conflicts:
	manifests/init.pp
	manifests/params.pp
	spec/classes/horizon_init_spec.rb
	templates/local_settings.py.erb

Backport note:
To minimize effect of this backport, the following change was made.
- The enable_user_pass parameter is not deprecated by this patch.

- Users can set the enable_user_pass parameter to undef to remove
  OPENSTACK_HEAT_STACK from local_settings.

- heatclient logging setting is left in local_settings, because
  consistent configuration is added.

Change-Id: I5999c2eaf8d7788d3c0d76e69a56a0b10058dfe9
(cherry picked from commit 382877dd4c8ee321eff1846c7c7afe4104dbd58f)

commit_message:
vpp: Accept array for physnets parameter

The ml2_vpp/physnets parameter is ListOpt which takes comma separated
list, so accepting an array value allows users to set the parameter
using the same type.

Change-Id: I8ef9bd75cd5afbdb784d584a2d9f282532370585

subject: Add support for iscsid configuration
messages:
[{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-06-03 15:02:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-06-03 15:05:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-06-03 15:12:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-06-03 15:12:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2021-06-03 15:15:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-06-03 15:17:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)

A problem with having this independent class is that we can't easily implement dependencies between services.

One solution would include this class from other modules like nova/cinder/glance which requires iscsid service. However that sounds overkilling to me, because iscsid is not required unless these components actually require iscsi connection.

I think we should leave the decision to users and expect they include this class properly in their manifests in case they need to maintain something."}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-06-03 15:41:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-06-03 15:50:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-06-03 15:59:44.000000000', 'content': 'Topic iscsid removed'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-06-03 15:59:49.000000000', 'content': 'Topic set to iscsid'}, {'account_id': 16137, 'date': '2021-06-03 19:26:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

IMO this should be something deployers need to fix - so we should probably add this to p-o-i instead'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-06-04 11:41:45.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-06-04 11:42:11.000000000', 'content': 'Set Work In Progress'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2021-06-08 18:18:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-06-09 06:34:47.000000000', 'content': 'Set Ready For Review'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2021-06-09 06:38:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

> Patch Set 4:
> 
> IMO this should be something deployers need to fix - so we should probably add this to p-o-i instead

I understnad you point and that is what I thought initially.

The problem here is that there seems to be no well-maintained popular iscsi modules. Because iscsid is required by some services like nova, cinder and etc as long as iscsi connection is required,
That is why I decided to make it a part of openstacklib which is consumable, instead of a private p-o-i. At least packstack which is consuming puppet-openstack would be interested in using this implementation.'}, {'account_id': 16312, 'date': '2021-06-15 13:01:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review+1

commit_message:
Add support for iscsid configuration

The iscsid service is used in sevral components like nova, cinder,
glance and so on to connect to iscsi devices. This change introduces
the new class to manage basic configuration of the iscsid service.

Co-authored-by: Alfredo Moralejo <amoralej@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I3fc6d1192632cc1458d00900508d548f522e9cdb
